head.title: Bond Sale Schedule For the Week Ahead

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: Bond Sale Schedule For the Week Ahead
hedline.hl2: Bond Sale Schedule for the Week Ahead

block.p: This week's schedule of Treasury auctions includes the sale of new three- and six-month bills today and a four-week bill on Tuesday.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 0.87 percent, the rate on the six-month issue was 0.93 percent and the rate on the four-week bill was 0.80 percent.
This week's schedule of Treasury auctions includes the sale of new three- and six-month bills today and a four-week bill on Tuesday.
This week's schedule of Treasury auctions includes the sale of new three- and six-month bills today and a four-week bill on Tuesday.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 0.87 percent, the rate on the six-month issue was 0.93 percent and the rate on the four-week bill was 0.80 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAX EXEMPT
TUESDAY
Alabama Public Housing Authority, $111.6 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
DeKalb County, Ga., $53.7 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Minnesota, $460 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Washington, $471.4 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Washington, $250.7 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY
Contra Costa, Calif., $248 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
Fairfield, Conn., $60 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Oakland, Calif., $71.8 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
THURSDAY
Minnesota, $460 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Monroe County, N.Y., $54.5 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TAX EXEMPT
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Albany, Municipal Water Finance Authority, $72 million of debt securities. First Albany.
Allegheny County, Pa., $104.2 million of general obligation bonds. Mellon Financial Markets.
Arizona transportation, $166 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Broward County, Fla., $60 million of revenue bonds. Siebert Brandford Shank & Company.
Lubbock, Tex., $55 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Clarkston, Mich., Community College District, $83 million of debt securities. UBS.
Connecticut Housing, $64 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
Butler County, Pa., $54.1 million of general obligation bonds. J. P. Morgan Securities.
Gainesville, Fla., Utility System, $150.4 million of revenue bonds. Goldman, Sachs.
Illinois Health Facilities Authority, $64.2 million of revenue bonds. J. P. Morgan Securities.
Manchester, N. H., $105 million of school bonds. Citigroup Global Markets.
Maryland Economic Development, $53 million of revenue bonds. First Albany.
New Jersey Transit, $950 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
New Orleans, La., Exposition Hall, $380 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Ohio State Commission, $200 million of school bonds. Citigroup Global Markets.
Spartanburg, S. C., Sewer, $70 million of revenue bonds. Raymond James.
Michigan State Building Authority, $768 million of revenue bonds. J. P. Morgan Securities.
Yavapai, Ariz., Community Hospital Association, $60 million of debt securities. Bear, Stearns.
